gcci.text: With H100 lease rates averaging $3.18/hr and supply still constrained by HBM and packaging bottlenecks, vendors must time capex and diversify vendors to avoid downstream cost spikes.

gtpi.text: An average input price of $1.25/1M tokens underscores aggressive price compression, pushing providers toward efficiency-driven models to sustain margins amid intensifying API competition.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual AI load represents a major grid stressor, accelerating the need for nuclear baseload and demand-response to stabilize carbon intensity and reliability.

aipi.text: Declining H100 rates and token prices indicate strong growth momentum, yet rapid capex expansion and margin pressure elevate bubble and stranded-asset risks for 2025.
